trans-unit.source: Creating a REST-based Client Application for Service Bus
trans-unit.target: Creating a REST-based Client Application for Service Bus

trans-unit.source: A client application can access a REST-style service by using the <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.WebHttpRelayBinding</codeEntityReference> binding, or by directly sending HTTP requests to the service endpoint.
trans-unit.target: A client application can access a REST-style service by using the <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.WebHttpRelayBinding</codeEntityReference> binding, or by directly sending HTTP requests to the service endpoint.

trans-unit.source: Some applications, such as browsers or JavaScript applications, do not use the Microsoft.ServiceBus.dll assembly.
trans-unit.target: Some applications, such as browsers or JavaScript applications, do not use the Microsoft.ServiceBus.dll assembly.

trans-unit.source: These applications can access a REST service endpoint directly using whatever HTTP capabilities available to them.
trans-unit.target: These applications can access a REST service endpoint directly using whatever HTTP capabilities available to them.

trans-unit.source: In this case, the only issue is what type of security and authentication the service requires.
trans-unit.target: In this case, the only issue is what type of security and authentication the service requires.

trans-unit.source: However, in this type of scenario, it is common for the service to require little or no authentication.
trans-unit.target: However, in this type of scenario, it is common for the service to require little or no authentication.

trans-unit.source: <token>crdefault</token> <link xlink:href="e86c9562-eae5-49be-b156-c95edc7f19d1" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How to: Host a REST Service through the AppFabric Service Bus</link>.
trans-unit.target: <token>crdefault</token> <link xlink:href="e86c9562-eae5-49be-b156-c95edc7f19d1" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How to: Host a REST Service through the AppFabric Service Bus</link>.

trans-unit.source: For a full example of this scenario, see the <externalLink><linkText>WebHttp</linkText><linkUri>http://code.msdn.microsoft.com/Relayed-Messaging-Bindings-a6477ba0</linkUri></externalLink> sample in the <link xlink:href="326d2e16-d70a-4d93-ab24-a84a3ac44305" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Service Bus Samples</link>, or the <link xlink:href="286326f9-883b-4191-a7df-f107f3cbc26a" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">REST Tutorial for AppFabric Service Bus</link>.
trans-unit.target: For a full example of this scenario, see the <externalLink><linkText>WebHttp</linkText><linkUri>http://code.msdn.microsoft.com/Relayed-Messaging-Bindings-a6477ba0</linkUri></externalLink> sample in the <link xlink:href="326d2e16-d70a-4d93-ab24-a84a3ac44305" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Service Bus Samples</link>, or the <link xlink:href="286326f9-883b-4191-a7df-f107f3cbc26a" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">REST Tutorial for AppFabric Service Bus</link>.

trans-unit.source: If the client has access to the Azure SDK, it follows the same procedure as a standard <token>sb2</token> client application.
trans-unit.target: If the client has access to the Azure SDK, it follows the same procedure as a standard <token>sb2</token> client application.

trans-unit.source: <token>crdefault</token> <link xlink:href="8829c9f8-db41-4d04-8c0b-fc390391e009" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How to: Create a Client Application for AppFabric Service Bus</link>.
trans-unit.target: <token>crdefault</token> <link xlink:href="8829c9f8-db41-4d04-8c0b-fc390391e009" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How to: Create a Client Application for AppFabric Service Bus</link>.

trans-unit.source: The only unique feature in this scenario is that attributes such as <codeInline>[WebGet]</codeInline> are applied to the contract you retrieve from the service.
trans-unit.target: The only unique feature in this scenario is that attributes such as <codeInline>[WebGet]</codeInline> are applied to the contract you retrieve from the service.

trans-unit.source: These attributes map the contract to the REST standard.
trans-unit.target: These attributes map the contract to the REST standard.

trans-unit.source: Because it is an Internet-based protocol, you are required to use an HTTP-based binding, such as <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.WebHttpRelayBinding</codeEntityReference>.
trans-unit.target: Because it is an Internet-based protocol, you are required to use an HTTP-based binding, such as <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.WebHttpRelayBinding</codeEntityReference>.
